name: Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Sunbutter Cookies
description: Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Sunbutter Cookies. Cinnamony Sunflower seed butter Oatmeal Cookies. These Soft Sunbutter Oatmeal Cookies come together really quickly and make a great snack or treat. Vegan Nut-free Recipe. Can be Gluten-free. 8 Ingredients!
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup smooth sunbutter or use almond butter (peanut butter or cashew butter)
3/4 cup (scant) cup flour (I use Spelt. Oat flour will work as well)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a bowl, mix the first 7 ingredients until smooth. It will take a minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a bowl, mix the first 7 ingredients until smooth. It will take a minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add oats, 1/2 cup flour and baking soda and mix well. Add flour 1 tbsp at a time to make a loose sticky mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Add oats, 1/2 cup flour and baking soda and mix well. Add flour 1 tbsp at a time to make a loose sticky mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: Fold in the chocolate chips. Use a scoop to place on parchment lined baking sheet.
recipeInstructions.name: Fold in the chocolate chips. Use a scoop to place on parchment lined baking sheet.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 10 to 11 minutes. Cookie slam the sheet once or twice so the cookies settle. Let cool completely. The cookies will be soft just baked, but will harden and set as they cool. Store on the counter for the day and covered for upto 4 days.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 10 to 11 minutes. Cookie slam the sheet once or twice so the cookies settle. Let cool completely. The cookies will be soft just baked, but will harden and set as they cool. Store on the counter for the day and covered for upto 4 days.
